root: ^Opens with MC in their House. There is a knock on the door.
^How did your investigation in House Ivy go?
^Well, apparently I'm not that good at sneaking around, and Levalon caught me.
^Yeah, I figured if you had obtained any significant information, you would have called me.
^Sorry. I've needed some time to process things.
^No need to apologize, I get it. But I'm curious about something.
^How many times am I going to get asked that?
^Many times, I'd imagine. Because it makes no sense. House Ivy's borders are infamously impenetrable. If there is something weird going on I need to know.
^In that case, you should know that the magic there was destabilizing.
^The magic everywhere is destabilizing. That's not new.
^Let me finish. The destabilized magic does more than just weaken one's magic abilities. Tell me, Ariar, where does magic come from?
^Well, it's an atmospheric substance that can be controlled.
^Right, so if magic is destabilizing, then we can infer that the atmosphere itself is destabilizing.
^Well, the atmosphere is destabilizing, and it's causing rifts.
^Yes, rifts. There are tears in the atmosphere. There was one right outside House Ivy, and I went through it.
^You say that as if I could have died.
^Well, lucky for me, I didn't. But when I went through I ended up in House Ivy.
^Yeah, it was great until I got caught.
^All the evidence fits into place now. It all makes sense, my friend!
^Right, yes, of course. As you know the public believes House Ivy to be guilty.
^Indeed, which is why I investigated them.

^Yes, I know. But while you were there I was doing my own investigation. All the evidence made me think that House Ivy was to blame, but I couldn't be sure. My friend, this is the last piece of evidence.

^Let me explain. At the Council, it was House Ivy who started the fight. Then, when everyone blamed them, did they have any evidence to refute the claim? No, they hid themselves from the world, as if they had something to hide. As suspicious as this was, I assumed that if those from House Ivy were all held within the borders, they would be unable to harm the world outside. But, as you have discovered, there are portals being used to enter and exit the house. Why would they close the borders and still have a hidden portal to enter and exit? They must be guilty.
^Ariar, I'm not so sure. This is a bold claim.
^Do you know the sin of House Ivy?
^Indeed. House Ivy is a proud house. They would defend their honor at all cost.
^Or it could be the opposite. Maybe they recognize that any public exposure would only hurt their image.

^Perhaps. I admit this is possible. But consider the motive behind destabilizing magic. What if House Ivy thought the rest of the world unworthy? What if they wanted the power of magic for themselves, thus making them superior to all other Houses? This makes too much sense.
^I agree. House Ivy is certainly a significant suspect in this crime, but we must be certain before we take action.
^We are certain. At least, I am. Sorry I don't want to impose my beliefs on you.
^If we wait any longer there will be no use. House Ivy will have conquered the world. There is still time to fight back.
^But what if we fight the wrong fight? What if House Ivy is innocent, then the true criminal will be able to conquer the world with ease.
^When have I ever been proven wrong?
^Two nights ago when you told me to go to that warehouse.
^That was a mistake, I'll yield, but I also saved your life.

^Yes. You did. And I do enjoy being alive, so thank you. However, Ariar, we have a reputation. The citizens of this world trust us. We must be certain beyond doubt before we act upon something so significant.
^I only wish to protect the citizens of this world.
^In that, we have the same intention.
^There is a knocc on the front door
^One moment, the door. But we're not done with this conversation.
^The MC opens the front door, revealing a somewhat disheveled looking devil, a member of Spider Lily.
^Oh good, you're home! I've been trying to find you everywhere.
^You've been looking for me? Who are you?
^I am Levili Clu, of House Spider Lily, though my status among my people has fallen greatly since you have last seen me. I was hoping to see you about that.
^Listen, I don't care what rumors have been spread, but I don't deal in blackmail jobs. I might not be aligned with a house, but I have my own code of honor to uphold.
^Apologies, but that is not what I am here about. I heard that you too have suffered the same malady that has been spreading across the land. The degradation of one's magical power.
^Yes, that is the case. What does it matter to you?
^I was hoping that you had discovered something more. I've been hearing about how House Ivy has pulled themselves out of external affairs and sealed their borders tighter than a otter-tortoise.
^Well you're not wrong in that regard, but may I ask the purpose of your business?

^Well I'm afraid that my condition is even worse than your own my friend. For the past few days, I haven't been able to summon up anything, not even a single spark. I fear that I've hit the bottom of my power, and I've been looking for a way to bring it back. House Ivy still retains some of it's magic power?

^There is no other use to their hiding. I have no authority to speak on behalf of House Spider-Lily, but be assured that House Spider-Lily will not be able to remain peaceful until our magic powers are restored.
^So could this be the start of a House War?
^I knew it. Friend, this is why immediate action is necessary. Any delay and there may no longer be a world to save.
^Caution is a luxury of time, and unfortunately our time is fleeting.
^Time is always fleeting. But you're right, the time for action is especially fleeting now. However, the notion of immediate action is something with which I cannot agree.

^Saving the world is never easy, friend. I think no less of you despite our disagreement. But we are truly on the verge of a House War, and if we do not take proper action, our world, along with all who inhabit it, are doomed. I cannot speak with certainty that House Ivy is guilty, though I see no possibility more reasonable. If we are wrong, and House Ivy falls on our action, this would truly be disappointing, and I will take full responsibility. Yet, if no action is taken, House Ivy will still fall. There is a chance to save the world. We just have to take a risk.
^Perhaps you are correct. The House War may be nearer than you expect. The alliance between Houses was always weak. Any minor disturbance could have caused a fatal fracture.
^The loss of magic is no minor disturbance.
^I am not sure if you are correct, Ariar, but I will trust you.
^However, I do it on my own terms. I believe we are all well aware that the constables will not take forceful action against any Houses at this point.
^So am I to understand we intend on making our own attack against House Ivy?
^House Spider-Lily is planning such an attack imminently.
^In this case, I will allow the attack to continue, but I will not make any direct attack against House Ivy.
^Perhaps you would still be able to provide us aid in this attack.
^The strongest warrior in House Ivy is Levalon himself. If you could provide a distraction-
^No need to continue, Levili. I have a plan.
